_header: As I came by a bower so fair
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 178.
_description: The complaint of a prisoner of love — four 8-line stanzas including refrain, ‘almes dede for our lady sake’

BodRawC813.First Lines:
As I came by a bowre Soo fayrwhen trees were bare bothe buske and
                    brer…
BodRawC813.Last Lines:
…I spake vnto that swete ageyneand askyd mercye for owr ladyes
                    sake
BodRawC813.Editions:
Padelford,  Frederick Morgan. 
             “Liedersammlungen des xvi. Jahrhunderts…IV.” 
             Anglia
         31 (1908): 309-96: 312-13.
Jansen,  Sharon L.,  and  Kathleen H. Jordan, eds.  
             The Welles Anthology: MS. Rawlinson C.813: A Critical Edition.
         Binghamton, NY: Medieval & Renaissance Texts and Studies,
            1991: 87-8.
